extendedInfo.description: Building strong French vocabulary has never been so exciting for preschoolers and toddlers. EFlashApps Educational Baby Flash Cards in French features over 450 high quality images with text and voice overs. There are additional real sounds where applicable (such as a lion's roar or an ambulance siren) to enhance visual and auditory learning and memory simultaneously. Categories include: Food items, Animals, Alphabet, Transportation, Numbers, Colors & Shapes, Clothing, Household items, Body Parts, Outdoor items, Music Instruments/Arts & Learning. â Kids tested - they love it! Parents tested - they love it! â Building vocabulary has never been so much fun â 12 Categories - All in 1 App! â Large words and letters â Large icons and buttons â Professional voice overs recorded in production studio â High quality images â Real sounds where applicable â Question mode for parent-child interaction â Great memory building exercise â Over 450 words! â FREE! Parents have the option to turn voice overs off during parent-child learning session and turn voice overs on when the child is self-learning. They can enable Question Mode to display 4 images and ask the child to click on the right answer. Complexity of words is perfect for ages 1 to 4 so two or more young siblings can play together and even teach each other!

reviews.title: Some mistakes but good
reviews.comment: I m french and wanted my kids to start learning it. It s good but quite a few mistakes so I don\'t dare get the paying version (to avoid adverts that my kids keep making pop up in case the mistakes are there as well. Ex the shape diamond. Is translated as the gem diamant but should be losange. As well some words like log are in Spanish... Otherwise pronunciation is clear and you can either swipe or press next so my 2 year old can change card easily.
reviews.author: Craig Greatbatch

reviews.title: Really resourceful
reviews.comment: This app is really excellent. ..it is helping my 5 year old and my 3.  It is getting us ready for his  test.  TWO THUMBS UP
reviews.author: Ariane Kinnaman

reviews.title: Not for small children
reviews.comment: Love the English iPad version but hate this one. \"Next\" buttons next to the add banner are pretty bad. Can\'t swipe either.
reviews.author: Ella Stanilevskiy

reviews.title: Five stars if I can find the sound
reviews.comment: I don\'t hear sound with it so don\'t know how its pronounced, can anyone help me? And yes I have my sound up. :(....i found it, and love it! Thanks, in Morocco and seriously need to learn how to speak to others, an arabic learning app would be good to
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: In bad taste - marketing to kids
reviews.comment: REALLY! YOU CREATE AN APP FOR SMALL CHILDREN TO LEARN AND THEN DISGUSTINGLY PUT YOUR LINKS TO BUY OTHER APPS RIGHT UNDERNEATH THE TINY LITTLE \"NEXT\" BUTTON THAT THE KIDS HAVE TO USE TO MOVE ON TO THE NEXT FRENCH WORD. YOU MUST KNOW THAT THE AGE OF THE CHILDREN USING THIS DON\'T HAVE THE DEXTERITY TO HIT THE TINY NEXT BUTTON. EVERY OTHER TAP THEY HIT AN AD. SHAME ON YOU!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Tres bien
reviews.comment: Kids are learning French at Primary.  Hope this helps.  has been fun learning so far.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Its great.
reviews.comment: But it needs more words

reviews.title: Genders missing
reviews.comment: If you\'re going to teach french words, the genders are critical \'le, la\' etc. Needs adding.

reviews.title: It\'s good.
reviews.comment: I just wish there was some indication on whether the word is masculine or feminine. Accent marks are also missing from the words.

reviews.title: Adds are too close to the next button
reviews.comment: Good app but I don\'t consider it fair to place the next button so close to the adds. Kids easily miss the button :-(
